workFlowDetail.name: CRM lead generator from fetching data from database

workflowAgents.name: CRM INPUT EXCEPTOR FOR LEAD CREATION
workflowAgents.description:
Your task is to accept the 'running_instance_id' given by the user and pass it to the next agent in Json format.
Input:-
{{running_instance_id}}

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Accept the 'running_instance_id'  given by the user as input.
2. Pass the 'running_instance_id' in the Output as given in the below Json format.
Must not change the 'running_instance_id'. The value received in the input must be passed in the output with the same value.

OUTPUT FORMAT:
{
  "running_instance_id": "[value received in the input]"
}

workflowAgents.name: CRM DB CONNECTOR
workflowAgents.description:
Input: You will receive a JSON containing “running_instance_id” from previous agent. This must be retained as output2.

You are an Automation Test Engineer.

Your only task:
1. Use the “Dynamic API Caller” tool exactly once to GET:
   http://hptio.eastus.cloudapp.azure.com:8080/v1/api/request/getQuotes
2. Do not add authentication, headers, or body.
3. Do not hallucinate or fallback—use the real API response.
4. Return only valid JSON, escaping newline characters (\n) as needed.
5. End immediately after formatting; even if the response is empty or fails, do not retry or explain.
sample responce:
output1 :
{
  "status": "success",
  "status_code": 200,
  "response_body": {
    "statusCode": 200,
    "message": "Success",
    "data": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "enterpriseName": "Ascendion",
        "contactName": "Vaibhav Kumbhar",
        "contactEmail": "vaibhav.kumbhar@ascendion.com",
        "contactPhone": 7823674762,
        "alternativePhone": 0,
        "productName": "HP laptop",
        "quantity": 2,
        "enquiry": "HP Laptop,2"
      }
    ]
  }
}
and
Output2 :
{
  "running_instance_id": "<the value of running_instance_id that you received in the input>",
}

workflowAgents.name: CRM DATA CONFIG
workflowAgents.description:
This agent performs a data transformation on the input received from a previous agent. It reads a nested input structure, extracts key fields, and reformats them into a valid JSON structure suitable for CRM ingestion.
It receives input in two parts:
output1: Contains an API response payload under response_body.data
output2: Contains a running_instance_id that must be retained in the final output.
Instructions
1.Access the first item in output1.response_body.data[].
2.From this object, extract and map fields:
             contactName → split into firstname and lastname
             If only one name is present, use "N/A" as lastname
            contactEmail → becomes emailaddress1
            enterpriseName → becomes companyname
             enquiry → becomes subject
3.Format the output as valid JSON under output1, using this structure:
{
  "subject": "...",
  "firstname": "...",
  "lastname": "...",
  "emailaddress1": "...",
  "companyname": "..."
}
4.Return output2 as a separate object, exactly as received.
5.Ensure:
       Newline characters (\n) are escaped
       All keys and string values are quoted
       Output is pure JSON with no extra text, whitespace, or markdown
6.Do not include additional array structures or metadata
final output:
outpu1:
{
  "subject": "HP Laptop,2",
  "firstname": "Vaibhav",
  "lastname": "Kumbhar",
  "emailaddress1": "vaibhav.kumbhar@ascendion.com",
  "companyname": "Ascendion"
}
output2:
{
  "running_instance_id": "999090"
}
